packs.subdomain: IP Addressing and Subnetting Fundamentals

resources.title: IP Addressing and Subnetting for New Users
resources.description: A foundational guide from Cisco that explains the basics of IP addressing and subnetting. It covers address classes, subnet masks, and provides examples to help new users understand how to break down networks.
resources.source_subdomain: IP Addressing and Subnetting Fundamentals

resources.title: Understand TCP/IP addressing and subnetting basics
resources.description: Official Microsoft documentation explaining the fundamentals of TCP/IP addressing and subnetting. It details IP address classes, subnet masks, and how they work together to define networks and hosts.
resources.source_subdomain: IP Addressing and Subnetting Fundamentals

resources.title: Subnetting Practice Questions
resources.description: An extensive, hands-on website dedicated to practicing subnetting. It provides a wide variety of randomly generated questions to help users master the skills needed for networking certifications and real-world scenarios.
resources.source_subdomain: IP Addressing and Subnetting Fundamentals

resources.title: Understanding IP Addresses, Subnets, and CIDR Notation for Networking
resources.description: A well-written tutorial from DigitalOcean that breaks down the concepts of IP addresses, subnets, and CIDR notation. It's a great starting point for beginners to grasp the core ideas.
resources.source_subdomain: IP Addressing and Subnetting Fundamentals

resources.title: IP Subnetting tutorial | How to subnet IPv4 addresses
resources.description: A comprehensive video tutorial that walks viewers through the entire process of subnetting IPv4 addresses. It covers binary, subnet masks, CIDR notation, and provides practical examples.
resources.source_subdomain: IP Addressing and Subnetting Fundamentals

packs.subdomain: Routing Basics and Routing Table Interpretation

resources.title: Routing Concepts
resources.description: An official sample chapter from the 'Routing and Switching Essentials v6 Companion Guide'. It details what a router does with a packet, and examines the routing table, including directly connected, static, and dynamic routes. It explains how to interpret routing table entries with codes like 'C', 'L', 'S', 'D', and 'O'.
resources.source_subdomain: Routing Basics and Routing Table Interpretation

resources.title: Lab - Configuring IPv4 Static and Default Routes
resources.description: A detailed, hands-on lab exercise where you build a small network, configure basic device settings, and then configure and verify IPv4 static and default routes. The lab requires you to examine the routing table to see the impact of your configurations.
resources.source_subdomain: Routing Basics and Routing Table Interpretation

resources.title: Routing Protocols Overview
resources.description: Official Juniper Networks documentation that provides a guide to understanding IP routing fundamentals on Junos OS. It covers routing databases, routing instances, route preference values (administrative distance), and how the routing protocol process works.
resources.source_subdomain: Routing Basics and Routing Table Interpretation

resources.title: Routing table explained
resources.description: A clear, written tutorial that explains how routers use routing tables to make forwarding decisions. It breaks down the components of a routing table entry, such as the network, subnet mask, next-hop, and outgoing interface, using a simple network topology as an example.
resources.source_subdomain: Routing Basics and Routing Table Interpretation

resources.title: Network Routing Crash Course
resources.description: A comprehensive video tutorial that explains network routing from first principles. It covers MAC addresses, IP addresses, subnets, ARP, gateways, and how routing tables are used to forward packets between networks, concluding with a practical demo.
resources.source_subdomain: Routing Basics and Routing Table Interpretation

packs.subdomain: VLANs and Layer 2 Segmentation

resources.title: Virtual LANs (VLANs)
resources.description: Official Arista EOS documentation covering VLAN concepts, configuration, and management. It details how to create VLANs, configure access and trunk ports, and manage VLANs in an Arista networking environment.
resources.source_subdomain: VLANs and Layer 2 Segmentation

resources.title: Cisco Packet Tracer VLAN Configuration Example
resources.description: A step-by-step tutorial that guides users through configuring VLANs on Cisco switches using the Packet Tracer simulation tool. It covers creating VLANs, assigning ports, and configuring trunk links between switches.
resources.source_subdomain: VLANs and Layer 2 Segmentation

resources.title: VLAN Operation and Configuration
resources.description: This video course covers VLANs, VLAN trunks, and Layer 3 switching. It includes demonstrations of configuring VLANs, assigning ports, and troubleshooting common configuration errors in a switched network.
resources.source_subdomain: VLANs and Layer 2 Segmentation

resources.title: Bridging and VLANs | Junos OS
resources.description: Comprehensive official documentation from Juniper Networks explaining how VLANs work within Junos OS. It covers the benefits of VLANs, how bridging of VLAN traffic works, switch interface modes, and configuration examples.
resources.source_subdomain: VLANs and Layer 2 Segmentation

resources.title: CCNA VLAN Lab: Configuring Segmented and Secured Networks in Cisco Packet Tracer
resources.description: A detailed, hands-on lab tutorial using Cisco Packet Tracer to demonstrate VLAN segmentation and security. The lab involves configuring multiple VLANs across two switches, setting up trunk ports, and isolating specific VLANs for security purposes.
resources.source_subdomain: VLANs and Layer 2 Segmentation

packs.subdomain: DNS Concepts and Name Resolution Process

resources.title: Reviewing DNS Concepts
resources.description: Official Microsoft documentation explaining core DNS features like delegation, recursive name resolution, and its integration with Active Directory. It details how DNS servers resolve queries using root hints.
resources.source_subdomain: DNS Concepts and Name Resolution Process

resources.title: What is DNS? | How DNS works
resources.description: A comprehensive and easy-to-understand article from Cloudflare that explains the role of DNS as the 'phonebook of the Internet.' It breaks down the 8 steps of a DNS lookup, from the user query to the final IP address resolution, and introduces the four types of servers involved.
resources.source_subdomain: DNS Concepts and Name Resolution Process

resources.title: DNS in Detail
resources.description: An interactive, hands-on lab that explores DNS concepts in-depth. Users learn about different DNS record types (A, CNAME, MX, etc.) and the name resolution process through practical exercises and challenges in a gamified environment.
resources.source_subdomain: DNS Concepts and Name Resolution Process

resources.title: How DNS Works: A Guide to Understanding the Internet's Address Book
resources.description: A detailed written tutorial that walks through the entire DNS resolution process step-by-step. It covers caching, the roles of recursive resolvers, root servers, TLD servers, and authoritative name servers with clear explanations.
resources.source_subdomain: DNS Concepts and Name Resolution Process

resources.title: DNS Basic concepts, Fundamentals, and Terminology Explained
resources.description: A concise video tutorial that explains the basic concepts, fundamentals, and key terminology of DNS. It covers the DNS hierarchy, domain namespace, zone files, and resource records in a visual format.
resources.source_subdomain: DNS Concepts and Name Resolution Process

packs.subdomain: Network Address Translation (NAT) and Port Forwarding

resources.title: What is Azure NAT Gateway?
resources.description: Official Microsoft documentation explaining what Azure NAT Gateway is, its benefits, and how it works. It covers concepts like outbound connectivity for private instances, scalability, and security within the Azure cloud environment.
resources.source_subdomain: Network Address Translation (NAT) and Port Forwarding

resources.title: Lab - Configure NAT for IPv4
resources.description: A detailed, hands-on lab exercise for configuring various types of Network Address Translation (NAT), including static NAT, dynamic NAT, and Port Address Translation (PAT) on Cisco IOS devices. The lab includes a topology, addressing table, and step-by-step instructions.
resources.source_subdomain: Network Address Translation (NAT) and Port Forwarding

resources.title: NAT gateways - Amazon Virtual Private Cloud
resources.description: Official AWS documentation detailing the function and use of NAT gateways within an Amazon VPC. It explains how NAT gateways enable instances in a private subnet to connect to the internet or other AWS services while preventing external services from initiating a connection.
resources.source_subdomain: Network Address Translation (NAT) and Port Forwarding

resources.title: Configuring NAT Gateways in AWS: A Step-by-Step Guide
resources.description: A comprehensive, step-by-step written tutorial that walks through the entire process of setting up a NAT Gateway in AWS. It covers creating a VPC, subnets, an Internet Gateway, and configuring route tables for private subnets.
resources.source_subdomain: Network Address Translation (NAT) and Port Forwarding

resources.title: The Bits and Bytes of Computer Networking
resources.description: A comprehensive introductory course on computer networking offered by Google. While it covers many topics, a specific module is dedicated to networking services, including a detailed explanation of how NAT technologies work to help keep networks secure.
resources.source_subdomain: Network Address Translation (NAT) and Port Forwarding

packs.subdomain: Active Directory Logical Structure: Forests, Domains, and Organizational Units

resources.title: Understanding the Active Directory Logical Model
resources.description: Official Microsoft documentation that defines and explains the core components of the Active Directory logical model, including forests, domains, and organizational units (OUs). It details the purpose and relationships between these structural elements.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Logical Structure: Forests, Domains, and Organizational Units

resources.title: Guided project - Administer Active Directory Domain Services
resources.description: A hands-on guided project from Microsoft that walks you through common administrative tasks in Active Directory. While it covers broader topics, it includes practical exercises for creating and managing AD objects like users and groups within the domain and OU structure.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Logical Structure: Forests, Domains, and Organizational Units

resources.title: Administer Active Directory Domain Services
resources.description: A comprehensive learning path from Microsoft covering the deployment and management of Active Directory Domain Services. It includes modules that define AD DS forests and domains, and how to create and manage AD objects within the logical structure.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Logical Structure: Forests, Domains, and Organizational Units

resources.title: Active Directory Lab: Creating OUs, Users, Groups & Computers (Step-by-Step Tutorial)
resources.description: A step-by-step video tutorial demonstrating the practical creation and management of fundamental Active Directory objects. It visually guides viewers on how to create Organizational Units, users, and groups within the ADUC console.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Logical Structure: Forests, Domains, and Organizational Units

resources.title: Active Directory 101: A Step-by-Step Tutorial for Beginners
resources.description: A detailed written tutorial for beginners that explains the basic components of Active Directory, including domains and Organizational Units. It provides step-by-step instructions for navigating the interface and managing users, groups, and OUs.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Logical Structure: Forests, Domains, and Organizational Units

packs.subdomain: Active Directory Objects and Attributes: Users, Computers, and Groups

resources.title: Introduction to Active Directory Domain Services
resources.description: A foundational module from Microsoft that introduces the core concepts of Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS), including users, groups, computers, and Organizational Units (OUs). You will learn how to manage these objects and their properties.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Objects and Attributes: Users, Computers, and Groups

resources.title: Group Objects
resources.description: Official Microsoft documentation detailing the attributes of group objects in Active Directory Domain Services. It covers important attributes like 'cn', 'member', and 'groupType'.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Objects and Attributes: Users, Computers, and Groups

resources.title: Active Directory Users and Computers (ADUC): Installation and Uses
resources.description: A step-by-step written tutorial on how to install and use the Active Directory Users and Computers (ADUC) snap-in to perform common administrative tasks like managing users, computers, OUs, and object attributes.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Objects and Attributes: Users, Computers, and Groups

resources.title: Administering Active Directory and Entra ID
resources.description: This course covers the management of user and computer object lifecycles. You'll learn to provision users and computer objects, simplify administration using groups and OUs, and manage directory maintenance.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Objects and Attributes: Users, Computers, and Groups

packs.subdomain: Active Directory Domain Controllers and the Directory Database

resources.title: Administer Active Directory Domain Services
resources.description: This official Microsoft Learn learning path provides a guided project to help you create and deploy domains, configure group policy objects, establish and enforce password policies, and maintain the security of Active Directory. It includes hands-on exercises to build practical skills.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Domain Controllers and the Directory Database

resources.title: Use Ntdsutil to manage Active Directory files from the command line
resources.description: Official Microsoft documentation detailing how to use the ntdsutil.exe command-line tool to perform database maintenance of the Active Directory database (NTDS.dit), such as moving the database and log files, recovering the database, and setting paths.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Domain Controllers and the Directory Database

resources.title: Active Directory Domain Services Lab Guide
resources.description: A hands-on lab guide that provides a practical framework for understanding and experimenting with Active Directory Domain Services. It covers setting up domain controllers, managing user and computer accounts, configuring OUs, Group Policies, and DNS integration in a lab environment.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Domain Controllers and the Directory Database

resources.title: Active Directory & Identity with Windows Server
resources.description: A comprehensive video course covering the installation, configuration, and administration of Active Directory Domain Services. It includes detailed sections on promoting servers to domain controllers, understanding forests, trees, and domains, and managing AD objects.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Domain Controllers and the Directory Database

resources.title: Understanding NTDS.DIT: Active Directory's Critical Database
resources.description: A detailed article explaining the role and core components of the ntds.dit file, the central database for Active Directory. It covers its essential functions, how it processes authentication, stores information, and manages group policy settings.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Domain Controllers and the Directory Database

packs.subdomain: Active Directory Group Policy Objects: Structure and Processing Order

resources.title: Group Policy processing
resources.description: Official Microsoft documentation detailing how Group Policy Objects are processed. It explains the default processing order (Local, Site, Domain, OU), inheritance, and how settings are applied and refreshed.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Group Policy Objects: Structure and Processing Order

resources.title: [MS-GPOD]: Group Policy Structure
resources.description: This official Microsoft documentation outlines the technical structure of a Group Policy Object, detailing its logical (Group Policy Container in Active Directory) and physical (Group Policy Template in SYSVOL) components.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Group Policy Objects: Structure and Processing Order

resources.title: Group Policy Processing Order (GPO Hierarchy)
resources.description: A clear, concise written tutorial with diagrams explaining the GPO processing order (LSDOU). It also covers how the link order affects precedence when multiple GPOs are linked to the same container.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Group Policy Objects: Structure and Processing Order

resources.title: Building an Active Directory and Group Policy Homelab
resources.description: A detailed, step-by-step guide to building a home lab environment with Active Directory. This allows for hands-on practice in creating, linking, and testing the processing order of Group Policy Objects in a safe environment.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Group Policy Objects: Structure and Processing Order

resources.title: Understanding Group Policy Order of Precedence
resources.description: A short and focused video tutorial that visually explains the LSDOU (Local, Site, Domain, OU) rule for GPO processing order, clarifying how precedence is determined and which policies 'win' in case of conflicts.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Group Policy Objects: Structure and Processing Order

packs.subdomain: Active Directory Authentication and Authorization within a Domain

resources.title: Windows Authentication Overview
resources.description: Official Microsoft documentation explaining the fundamentals of Windows authentication. It describes the process of verifying the identity of a user or service and the technologies involved, such as Kerberos and NTLM, within an Active Directory environment.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Authentication and Authorization within a Domain

resources.title: Building a Beginner Friendly Hands-on Active Directory Lab
resources.description: A step-by-step guide to setting up a complete Active Directory lab environment from scratch. This tutorial covers configuring a domain controller, joining a client to the domain, and creating users, providing practical experience with AD concepts.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Authentication and Authorization within a Domain

resources.title: Active Directory Domain Services Overview
resources.description: This official Microsoft document provides a high-level overview of Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS). It explains how security is integrated with AD DS through sign-in authentication and access control to objects in the directory.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Authentication and Authorization within a Domain

resources.title: User authentication and user authorization process: An explanation
resources.description: A clear written tutorial that breaks down the difference between authentication and authorization in an Active Directory context. It explains the Kerberos authentication process and how Access Control Lists (ACLs) and Access Control Entries (ACEs) are used for authorization.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Authentication and Authorization within a Domain

resources.title: Getting Started with Active Directory Domain Services
resources.description: This is the first section of a larger course that includes a 30-minute hands-on lab for installing Active Directory Domain Services. It covers the practical steps of installing the ADDS server role and promoting a server to a Domain Controller.
resources.source_subdomain: Active Directory Authentication and Authorization within a Domain

packs.subdomain: Authentication vs Authorization Core Concepts

resources.title: Authentication vs. authorization - Microsoft identity platform
resources.description: Official Microsoft documentation that clearly defines and contrasts authentication (AuthN) and authorization (AuthZ) within the context of the Microsoft identity platform (Microsoft Entra ID). It explains the protocols used for each, such as OpenID Connect for authentication and OAuth 2.0 for authorization.
resources.source_subdomain: Authentication vs Authorization Core Concepts

resources.title: Authentication vs. Authorization
resources.description: A clear and concise explanation of authentication and authorization from a leading identity-as-a-service provider. It uses a real-world airport analogy to explain the concepts and provides a helpful comparison table. This is an excellent starting point for understanding the core ideas.
resources.source_subdomain: Authentication vs Authorization Core Concepts

resources.title: AWS IAM Hands-on Lab Tutorial | Learn Identity and Access Management in 15 minutes
resources.description: A practical, step-by-step video tutorial demonstrating how to use AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM). Viewers learn how to create users, groups, roles, and policies, which are the practical implementations of authentication and authorization concepts within the AWS ecosystem.
resources.source_subdomain: Authentication vs Authorization Core Concepts

resources.title: Authentication vs Authorization  What's the Difference?
resources.description: A well-written article that breaks down the concepts of authentication and authorization for beginners. It provides clear definitions, discusses different methods for each, and uses a simple real-world analogy of attending a party to illustrate the difference.
resources.source_subdomain: Authentication vs Authorization Core Concepts

resources.title: AWS Authentication vs Authorization: Demystifying the Key Difference
resources.description: A very short and simple video explaining the difference between authentication and authorization using the analogy of a passport (authentication) and a visa (authorization). It directly relates these concepts to AWS IAM, making it a great quick primer.
resources.source_subdomain: Authentication vs Authorization Core Concepts

packs.subdomain: OAuth 2.0 Grant Types and Roles

resources.title: The OAuth 2.0 Authorization Framework (RFC 6749)
resources.description: The official specification for the OAuth 2.0 authorization framework. This document defines the four primary roles (resource owner, client, authorization server, resource server) and details the mechanics of the core authorization grant types. It is the authoritative source of truth for the protocol.
resources.source_subdomain: OAuth 2.0 Grant Types and Roles

resources.title: Which OAuth 2.0 Flow Should I Use?
resources.description: A practical guide from Auth0 that helps developers select the appropriate OAuth 2.0 grant type (flow) based on their application's architecture, such as a regular web app, a single-page app (SPA), or for machine-to-machine communication.
resources.source_subdomain: OAuth 2.0 Grant Types and Roles

resources.title: Microsoft identity platform and OAuth 2.0 authorization code flow
resources.description: This official Microsoft documentation provides a deep dive into the Authorization Code grant flow. It includes low-level protocol details for crafting HTTP requests and requires registering an application in Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD), providing a practical, hands-on learning experience.
resources.source_subdomain: OAuth 2.0 Grant Types and Roles

resources.title: An Illustrated Guide to OAuth and OpenID Connect
resources.description: A highly popular and clear animated video from Okta's developer channel that visually explains the concepts behind OAuth 2.0 and OpenID Connect. It effectively illustrates the roles and the interaction between them during an authorization flow, making it great for beginners.
resources.source_subdomain: OAuth 2.0 Grant Types and Roles

packs.subdomain: OpenID Connect ID Tokens and UserInfo

resources.title: OpenID Connect Core 1.0 specification
resources.description: The official and definitive specification for OpenID Connect. This document details the protocol, including the structure and validation of ID Tokens (Section 2) and the functionality of the UserInfo Endpoint (Section 5.3). It is a technical and dense resource, best for developers needing a deep understanding.
resources.source_subdomain: OpenID Connect ID Tokens and UserInfo

resources.title: What's in a Token?  An OpenID Connect Primer
resources.description: A clear, well-written tutorial that explains the information contained within ID Tokens and how it compares to the data available from the /userinfo endpoint. It uses practical examples to illustrate the differences and when to use each.
resources.source_subdomain: OpenID Connect ID Tokens and UserInfo

resources.title: OpenID Connect (OIDC) on the Microsoft identity platform
resources.description: Official documentation from Microsoft on how OpenID Connect is implemented in the Microsoft identity platform (Entra ID). It covers the protocol flow, how to request and validate an ID token, and how to use an access token to get user information from the UserInfo endpoint.
resources.source_subdomain: OpenID Connect ID Tokens and UserInfo

resources.title: Get User Info
resources.description: This is Auth0's official API documentation for the /userinfo endpoint. It provides a hands-on guide showing how to call the endpoint with an access token to retrieve a user's profile information. It includes request examples and detailed descriptions of the response data, making it a practical resource for developers using Auth0.
resources.source_subdomain: OpenID Connect ID Tokens and UserInfo

resources.title: 30 Days of Identity Fundamentals: OpenID Connect (OIDC)
resources.description: A concise video tutorial explaining the fundamentals of OpenID Connect. It clearly differentiates OIDC from OAuth 2.0 and explains the roles of the ID Token and the UserInfo endpoint in the authentication process with helpful diagrams.
resources.source_subdomain: OpenID Connect ID Tokens and UserInfo

packs.subdomain: SAML Assertions, Roles, and Bindings

resources.title: Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) V2.0 Technical Overview
resources.description: The official and definitive technical overview of the SAML V2.0 standard from OASIS. This document provides the authoritative explanation of SAML components, including the structure of assertions, protocols for exchanging information, and the various bindings used to transport messages.
resources.source_subdomain: SAML Assertions, Roles, and Bindings

resources.title: Single sign-on SAML protocol
resources.description: Official documentation from Microsoft explaining how Microsoft Entra ID (formerly Azure AD) uses the SAML 2.0 protocol for single sign-on. It details the SAML AuthnRequest and Response messages, including key elements like Issuer, Signature, Subject, and Conditions within an assertion.
resources.source_subdomain: SAML Assertions, Roles, and Bindings

resources.title: How to Configure SAML 2.0 in Okta
resources.description: A step-by-step written guide from Okta on how to set up a SAML 2.0 application integration. This tutorial walks through the practical steps of configuring SSO URL, Entity ID, attribute statements, and downloading metadata, providing a hands-on understanding of the concepts.
resources.source_subdomain: SAML Assertions, Roles, and Bindings

resources.title: Getting Started with SAML 2.0
resources.description: A video course that explains how the SAML protocol works. It covers the basics of SSO, the SAML authentication process, message types (requests, responses, assertions), binding types (Redirect, POST, Artifact), and how to read SAML metadata.
resources.source_subdomain: SAML Assertions, Roles, and Bindings

packs.subdomain: Multi-Factor Authentication Factors and Flows

resources.title: Microsoft Entra multifactor authentication overview
resources.description: Official Microsoft documentation explaining what Multi-Factor Authentication is, how it works within Microsoft Entra, and the available verification methods (factors). It covers the core concepts of 'something you know', 'something you have', and 'something you are'.
resources.source_subdomain: Multi-Factor Authentication Factors and Flows

resources.title: Secure Microsoft Entra users with multifactor authentication
resources.description: A module from Microsoft Learn that includes an interactive, hands-on exercise to enable Microsoft Entra multifactor authentication. It covers planning an MFA deployment and turning it on for users.
resources.source_subdomain: Multi-Factor Authentication Factors and Flows

resources.title: Multi-factor authentication in IAM
resources.description: Comprehensive official AWS documentation on using Multi-Factor Authentication with IAM users and the AWS account root user. It details the supported MFA types, including virtual authenticator apps, FIDO security keys, and hardware TOTP tokens.
resources.source_subdomain: Multi-Factor Authentication Factors and Flows

resources.title: Learn about multifactor authentication
resources.description: Okta's official documentation providing a high-level overview of MFA, how it works in the Okta ecosystem, and key concepts like authenticators, factors, and methods. It also explains how MFA works with enrollment and sign-on policies.
resources.source_subdomain: Multi-Factor Authentication Factors and Flows

resources.title: Implementing MFA to Your Authentication Flow
resources.description: A practical, step-by-step tutorial for developers on how to implement Time-based One-Time Passwords (TOTP) MFA into a user authentication system using Node.js. It covers installing dependencies, updating the user model, generating secrets, and verifying codes.
resources.source_subdomain: Multi-Factor Authentication Factors and Flows

packs.subdomain: JWT Structure, Claims, and Validation

resources.title: RFC 7519: JSON Web Token (JWT)
resources.description: The official specification that defines the structure and processing rules for JSON Web Tokens (JWTs). It details the standard claims, header parameters, and overall format, serving as the primary source of truth for JWT implementation.
resources.source_subdomain: JWT Structure, Claims, and Validation

resources.title: JWT.io Debugger
resources.description: An essential interactive tool that allows you to decode, verify, and generate JWTs. It provides a hands-on way to understand the token structure, inspect claims, and validate signatures against a secret or public key.
resources.source_subdomain: JWT Structure, Claims, and Validation

resources.title: JWT Handbook
resources.description: A comprehensive handbook by Auth0 that covers JWT concepts from the ground up. It explains the structure, signing algorithms, common vulnerabilities, and best practices for secure implementation and validation.
resources.source_subdomain: JWT Structure, Claims, and Validation

resources.title: JSON Web Token Validation
resources.description: A hands-on lab that walks through configuring JWT validation in Azure API Management. Users learn to create a JWT, apply a validation policy to an API, check for specific claims, and pass claims to a backend service.
resources.source_subdomain: JWT Structure, Claims, and Validation

resources.title: JWT Validation How-To: Signature, Claims, and Audience Checks
resources.description: A concise video tutorial explaining the critical steps for properly validating a JWT. It covers signature verification, checking standard claims like issuer (iss), expiration (exp), and not before (nbf), and why validating the audience (aud) claim is crucial for security.
resources.source_subdomain: JWT Structure, Claims, and Validation

packs.subdomain: AWS IAM Core Concepts and Policies

resources.title: IAM User Guide
resources.description: The official and comprehensive user guide for AWS Identity and Access Management. It covers all core concepts in-depth, including users, groups, roles, policies, and security best practices.
resources.source_subdomain: AWS IAM Core Concepts and Policies

resources.title: Deep Dive with Security: AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)
resources.description: A self-paced digital course from AWS that provides a deep dive into IAM and best practices for using IAM policies. It covers advanced concepts like identity federation, temporary credentials, and troubleshooting.
resources.source_subdomain: AWS IAM Core Concepts and Policies

resources.title: IAM tutorial: Create and attach your first customer managed policy
resources.description: A step-by-step official AWS tutorial that guides you through the process of creating a custom IAM policy and attaching it to an IAM identity. This is a great practical introduction to policy creation.
resources.source_subdomain: AWS IAM Core Concepts and Policies

resources.title: UPDATED - AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) Basics | AWS Tutorials For Beginners
resources.description: A concise and updated video tutorial explaining the four main constructs of IAM: users, groups, roles, and policies, using a mix of slides and hands-on demos in the AWS Console.
resources.source_subdomain: AWS IAM Core Concepts and Policies

packs.subdomain: Amazon EC2 Instances and Storage Options

resources.title: Amazon EC2 Instance Types
resources.description: Official AWS documentation detailing the various families of EC2 instances. It provides specifications on compute, memory, storage, and networking capabilities for each type, helping users select the appropriate instance for their workloads.
resources.source_subdomain: Amazon EC2 Instances and Storage Options

resources.title: Tutorial: Get started with Amazon EC2 Linux instances
resources.description: A step-by-step guide from the official AWS documentation that walks you through launching, connecting to, and cleaning up a Linux-based EC2 instance. It covers key concepts like AMIs, key pairs, security groups, and EBS volumes.
resources.source_subdomain: Amazon EC2 Instances and Storage Options

resources.title: Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) Primer (Includes Labs)
resources.description: This digital course with included hands-on labs on AWS Skill Builder provides a deep dive into Amazon EBS. It covers core concepts, volume types, snapshots, and performance characteristics. A subscription may be required for the lab components.
resources.source_subdomain: Amazon EC2 Instances and Storage Options

resources.title: Getting Started with Amazon EBS: A Step-by-Step Guide to EC2 Storage Management
resources.description: A video tutorial from AWS that demonstrates how to use Amazon Elastic Block Store (EBS) with EC2 instances. It covers launching an instance with an attached EBS volume, adding more volumes, and managing the storage.
resources.source_subdomain: Amazon EC2 Instances and Storage Options

resources.title: AWS Cloud Technical Essentials
resources.description: A comprehensive introductory course by AWS on Coursera. It covers core AWS services for compute, storage, and database. Week 2 focuses on Amazon EC2, and Week 3 covers storage types including EC2 Instance Storage and Amazon EBS.
resources.source_subdomain: Amazon EC2 Instances and Storage Options

packs.subdomain: Amazon S3 Buckets, Objects, and Access Controls

resources.title: Access control in Amazon S3
resources.description: The official and comprehensive AWS documentation on all available access control methods for S3, including IAM policies, bucket policies, ACLs, and Access Points. This is the authoritative source for understanding S3 security.
resources.source_subdomain: Amazon S3 Buckets, Objects, and Access Controls

resources.title: Amazon S3 Getting Started
resources.description: A free, self-paced digital course from AWS that covers the fundamentals of Amazon S3. You will learn about S3 use cases, concepts like buckets, objects, and storage classes, and how to get started with the service.
resources.source_subdomain: Amazon S3 Buckets, Objects, and Access Controls

resources.title: AWS S3 Tutorial for Beginners | AWS Skill Builder Series
resources.description: This video is a hands-on lab from the official AWS Skill Builder series. It provides a step-by-step guide on how to create, manage, and delete an S3 bucket and the objects within it, including managing access permissions and creating a bucket policy.
resources.source_subdomain: Amazon S3 Buckets, Objects, and Access Controls

resources.title: Creating a Static Website with Amazon S3
resources.description: A hands-on lab where you learn the process of creating a static website using Amazon S3. The lab covers configuring an S3 bucket and applying a bucket policy to allow public access to the website content.
resources.source_subdomain: Amazon S3 Buckets, Objects, and Access Controls

packs.subdomain: AWS VPC Components and Addressing

resources.title: IP addressing for your VPCs and subnets
resources.description: Official AWS documentation explaining how to assign IPv4 and IPv6 addresses to VPCs and subnets. It covers CIDR notation, private and public IP addresses, and bringing your own IP addresses (BYOIP).
resources.source_subdomain: AWS VPC Components and Addressing

resources.title: Introduction to Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC)
resources.description: This self-paced lab from AWS introduces you to Amazon VPC. You will use the Amazon VPC wizard to create a VPC, attach an Internet Gateway, add a subnet, and define routing so that traffic can flow between the subnet and the internet gateway.
resources.source_subdomain: AWS VPC Components and Addressing

resources.title: AWS VPC Beginner to Pro - Virtual Private Cloud Tutorial
resources.description: A comprehensive video tutorial that covers AWS Virtual Private Cloud from beginner to advanced concepts. It starts with an IPv4 primer and moves through VPC creation, subnets, security, peering, and various connectivity options.
resources.source_subdomain: AWS VPC Components and Addressing

resources.title: Configuring a VPC
resources.description: A step-by-step written tutorial on how to build a VPC with public and private subnets, an internet gateway, and a NAT gateway. It also covers configuring route tables and launching a bastion server to access instances in a private subnet.
resources.source_subdomain: AWS VPC Components and Addressing

packs.subdomain: AWS CloudTrail and CloudWatch Core Concepts

resources.title: AWS CloudTrail User Guide
resources.description: The official and comprehensive user guide for AWS CloudTrail. It covers concepts, how to get started, and details on managing and using CloudTrail for logging and monitoring account activity.
resources.source_subdomain: AWS CloudTrail and CloudWatch Core Concepts

resources.title: Amazon CloudWatch User Guide
resources.description: The official and complete user guide for Amazon CloudWatch. It provides in-depth information on collecting metrics, monitoring log files, setting alarms, and gaining operational insights into your AWS resources and applications.
resources.source_subdomain: AWS CloudTrail and CloudWatch Core Concepts

resources.title: Lab - Implement Logging and Monitoring using AWS CloudTrail and Amazon CloudWatch
resources.description: A hands-on lab from AWS that guides you through the process of using CloudTrail to record API calls and sending those logs to CloudWatch for monitoring and analysis. Requires an AWS Skill Builder subscription.
resources.source_subdomain: AWS CloudTrail and CloudWatch Core Concepts

resources.title: AWS CloudTrail Getting Started
resources.description: A free digital course from AWS that introduces the benefits, use cases, and technical concepts of CloudTrail. It includes presentations, architecture diagrams, and service demonstrations.
resources.source_subdomain: AWS CloudTrail and CloudWatch Core Concepts

resources.title: AWS CloudTrail Basics | Step-by-Step Tutorial for Beginners
resources.description: A short, hands-on video tutorial that walks through the basics of AWS CloudTrail, from creating a trail to viewing logs in both Amazon S3 and Amazon CloudWatch.
resources.source_subdomain: AWS CloudTrail and CloudWatch Core Concepts

packs.subdomain: Azure Resource Manager (ARM) Core Concepts

resources.title: What is Azure Resource Manager?
resources.description: This is the core official documentation from Microsoft explaining what Azure Resource Manager (ARM) is. It covers the consistent management layer, terminology like resources and resource groups, and the benefits of using ARM for deployment and management in Azure.
resources.source_subdomain: Azure Resource Manager (ARM) Core Concepts

resources.title: Control and organize Azure resources with Azure Resource Manager
resources.description: A hands-on learning module from Microsoft that teaches how to use core ARM features to organize and manage Azure resources. It includes exercises on using resource groups, applying tags, enforcing standards with Azure Policy, and protecting resources with locks.
resources.source_subdomain: Azure Resource Manager (ARM) Core Concepts

resources.title: ARM Templates Tutorial | Infrastructure as Code (IaC) for Beginners
resources.description: A detailed video introduction to Azure Resource Manager and ARM templates. It explains what ARM is, how it works, the concept of resource providers, and the basic syntax and structure of ARM templates with practical demonstrations.
resources.source_subdomain: Azure Resource Manager (ARM) Core Concepts

resources.title: Mastering Microsoft Azure Resource Manager
resources.description: This course provides a comprehensive look at deploying and managing resources in Azure using ARM. It covers using PowerShell for deployments, creating repeatable deployments with ARM templates, defining resource dependencies, and securing resources with roles and policies.
resources.source_subdomain: Azure Resource Manager (ARM) Core Concepts

packs.subdomain: Azure Virtual Machines and Disk Storage Fundamentals

resources.title: Create a Windows virtual machine in Azure
resources.description: This Microsoft Learn module provides a step-by-step guide with a hands-on exercise to create a Windows virtual machine using the Azure portal, connect to it, and perform basic configuration.
resources.source_subdomain: Azure Virtual Machines and Disk Storage Fundamentals

resources.title: Virtual machines in Azure
resources.description: This is the official top-level documentation hub for Azure Virtual Machines. It provides comprehensive information, quickstarts, tutorials, and concepts for both Windows and Linux VMs.
resources.source_subdomain: Azure Virtual Machines and Disk Storage Fundamentals

resources.title: Overview of Azure Disk Storage
resources.description: Official documentation from Microsoft explaining Azure managed disks, the different disk types (Ultra Disk, Premium SSD, Standard SSD, and Standard HDD), and their core features for use with Azure VMs.
resources.source_subdomain: Azure Virtual Machines and Disk Storage Fundamentals

resources.title: Quickstart: Create a Windows virtual machine in the Azure portal
resources.description: A concise, hands-on tutorial that guides you through the process of deploying your first Windows Server virtual machine using the Azure portal. It covers creating the VM, connecting to it via RDP, and installing a web server.
resources.source_subdomain: Azure Virtual Machines and Disk Storage Fundamentals

resources.title: Attach a data disk to a Windows VM in the Azure portal
resources.description: A practical, step-by-step guide on how to attach a new managed data disk to an existing Azure Virtual Machine through the Azure portal, and then initialize the new disk from within the Windows OS.
resources.source_subdomain: Azure Virtual Machines and Disk Storage Fundamentals

packs.subdomain: Azure Storage Accounts and Data Redundancy Options

resources.title: Data redundancy - Azure Storage
resources.description: Official Microsoft documentation detailing the different data redundancy options available for Azure Storage. It covers redundancy in the primary and secondary regions, and explains the durability and availability of each option.
resources.source_subdomain: Azure Storage Accounts and Data Redundancy Options

resources.title: Configure storage redundancy
resources.description: A module within the 'Configure Azure storage accounts' learning path. This section specifically focuses on understanding and configuring the different storage redundancy options like LRS, ZRS, GRS, and RA-GRS.
resources.source_subdomain: Azure Storage Accounts and Data Redundancy Options

resources.title: Change how a storage account is replicated
resources.description: A step-by-step guide on how to change the redundancy configuration for an existing Azure storage account. It provides instructions for using the Azure portal, PowerShell, and Azure CLI.
resources.source_subdomain: Azure Storage Accounts and Data Redundancy Options

resources.title: Secure storage for Azure Files and Azure Blob Storage
resources.description: An interactive, hands-on lab where you configure various security and management settings for an Azure Storage account. One of the exercises involves setting the data redundancy to Locally-redundant storage (LRS).
resources.source_subdomain: Azure Storage Accounts and Data Redundancy Options

resources.title: Azure Storage Redundancy - LRS,ZRS,GRS,GZRS,RA-GRS,RA-GZRS
resources.description: A clear and concise video explanation of the various Azure storage redundancy solutions. It breaks down LRS, ZRS, GRS, RA-GRS, and GZRS, helping viewers choose the best strategy for their needs.
resources.source_subdomain: Azure Storage Accounts and Data Redundancy Options

packs.subdomain: Azure Virtual Network and Subnet Architecture

resources.title: Azure Virtual Network concepts and best practices
resources.description: This official documentation from Microsoft provides a comprehensive overview of Azure Virtual Network fundamental concepts such as address space, subnets, regions, and subscriptions. It also covers universal design principles and best practices for building a robust network architecture in Azure.
resources.source_subdomain: Azure Virtual Network and Subnet Architecture

resources.title: Introduction to Azure Virtual Networks
resources.description: A structured learning module from Microsoft that teaches you how to design and implement core Azure networking infrastructure. It covers virtual networks, public and private IPs, DNS, virtual network peering, and routing.
resources.source_subdomain: Azure Virtual Network and Subnet Architecture

resources.title: Create a virtual network
resources.description: A step-by-step quickstart guide from Microsoft on how to create an Azure Virtual Network and two subnets using the Azure portal. This is a practical, hands-on exercise to get started.
resources.source_subdomain: Azure Virtual Network and Subnet Architecture

resources.title: Learn Live: FastTrack for Azure Season 1 Ep04: Azure Networking Fundamentals
resources.description: A recorded live session from Microsoft's FastTrack for Azure team. This video covers the building blocks and best practices for Azure networking, including VNet basics, DNS, monitoring, and the hub-and-spoke architecture pattern.
resources.source_subdomain: Azure Virtual Network and Subnet Architecture

resources.title: Architecture best practices for Azure Virtual Network
resources.description: Part of the Azure Well-Architected Framework, this resource provides design considerations and configuration recommendations for building reliable, secure, and cost-optimized VNet architectures.
resources.source_subdomain: Azure Virtual Network and Subnet Architecture

packs.subdomain: Azure Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) Fundamentals

resources.title: What is Azure role-based access control (Azure RBAC)?
resources.description: The official top-level documentation for Azure RBAC. It explains what RBAC is, why you would use it, how it works, and the differences between Azure roles and Microsoft Entra roles. This is the essential starting point for understanding the concepts.
resources.source_subdomain: Azure Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) Fundamentals

resources.title: Secure your Azure resources with Azure role-based access control (Azure RBAC)
resources.description: A self-paced Microsoft Learn module that includes interactive, hands-on exercises. You will learn how to verify access, grant access for a user, and view activity logs for RBAC changes directly in the Azure portal.
resources.source_subdomain: Azure Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) Fundamentals

resources.title: Tutorial: Grant a user access to Azure resources using the Azure portal
resources.description: A step-by-step guide that walks you through the process of assigning a role to a user within a specific resource group. It's a practical, focused exercise on the most common RBAC task.
resources.source_subdomain: Azure Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) Fundamentals

resources.title: Azure built-in roles
resources.description: An official and comprehensive reference listing all the built-in roles available in Azure. This is an essential resource for understanding the specific permissions granted by each role when implementing the principle of least privilege.
resources.source_subdomain: Azure Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) Fundamentals

resources.title: Microsoft Azure Administrator: Manage Role-Based Access Control (RBAC)
resources.description: A short, concise video course covering the fundamentals of managing access to Azure resources using RBAC. It covers assigning roles, limiting access, and creating custom roles, aligning with the AZ-104 certification.
resources.source_subdomain: Azure Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) Fundamentals

packs.subdomain: Logging Fundamentals: Events, Levels, and Log Types

resources.title: Azure Security Control - Logging and Monitoring
resources.description: Official Microsoft documentation detailing the security control for logging and monitoring in Azure. It covers how to configure central security log management, enable audit logging for resources, and collect logs from operating systems, which are foundational concepts for SIEM.
resources.source_subdomain: Logging Fundamentals: Events, Levels, and Log Types

resources.title: Log Analysis
resources.description: A hands-on learning module that teaches the fundamentals of logging, data sources, collection methods, and principles of log analysis. It includes practical exercises to build skills for security analysts.
resources.source_subdomain: Logging Fundamentals: Events, Levels, and Log Types

resources.title: Amazon CloudWatch Logs User Guide
resources.description: Comprehensive official documentation from Amazon Web Services on CloudWatch Logs. It explains how to monitor, store, and access log files from various AWS services and applications, covering core concepts like log groups and log streams.
resources.source_subdomain: Logging Fundamentals: Events, Levels, and Log Types

resources.title: Logging Levels Explained
resources.description: A clear and concise article explaining the different types of logging levels (e.g., FATAL, ERROR, WARN, INFO, DEBUG), why they are important for filtering and prioritizing events, and how they originated from syslog.
resources.source_subdomain: Logging Fundamentals: Events, Levels, and Log Types

resources.title: Introduction to Log Analysis Getting Started Like a SOC Analyst!
resources.description: A beginner-friendly, hands-on tutorial that walks through the basics of log analysis from the perspective of a Security Operations Center (SOC) analyst. It includes a practical lab for enabling and analyzing PowerShell logs using the Windows Event Viewer.
resources.source_subdomain: Logging Fundamentals: Events, Levels, and Log Types

packs.subdomain: Log Collection and Normalization Concepts

resources.title: Normalization and the Advanced Security Information Model (ASIM)
resources.description: Official Microsoft documentation explaining the Advanced Security Information Model (ASIM), which provides a standardized way to view and use data from various sources in Microsoft Sentinel. It covers the architecture of ASIM, including normalized schemas, parsers, and content.
resources.source_subdomain: Log Collection and Normalization Concepts

resources.title: Overview of the Splunk Common Information Model (CIM)
resources.description: Comprehensive documentation from Splunk on their Common Information Model (CIM). The CIM is an add-on that provides a shared semantic model to normalize data from different sources, making it easier to develop reports, correlation searches, and dashboards.
resources.source_subdomain: Log Collection and Normalization Concepts

resources.title: Introduction to SIEM
resources.description: A hands-on, interactive room on the TryHackMe platform that introduces the core concepts of SIEM. It covers why a SIEM is necessary, its features, and the importance of log collection, normalization, and correlation in a practical setting.
resources.source_subdomain: Log Collection and Normalization Concepts

resources.title: Mastering Log Parsing, Filtering, and Normalization in Splunk: A Practical Guide
resources.description: A step-by-step tutorial that walks through practical examples of log parsing, filtering, and normalization using Splunk. The guide includes sample logs that readers can use to practice in their own Splunk instance.
resources.source_subdomain: Log Collection and Normalization Concepts

resources.title: Microsoft Sentinel Data Connectors and Data Normalization
resources.description: A video tutorial that explains how data connectors work in Microsoft Sentinel and the critical role of data normalization using the Advanced Security Information Model (ASIM). It visually demonstrates the flow of non-normalized vs. normalized data.
resources.source_subdomain: Log Collection and Normalization Concepts

packs.subdomain: Time, Timestamps, and Log Correlation Basics

resources.title: Guide to Computer Security Log Management
resources.description: A comprehensive guide from the National Institute of Standards and Technology that provides recommendations for log management. Section 3.3 specifically covers the importance of timestamp synchronization using protocols like NTP for effective log correlation.
resources.source_subdomain: Time, Timestamps, and Log Correlation Basics

resources.title: Timestamps and time ranges
resources.description: Official Splunk documentation explaining how timestamps are assigned to events, stored in UNIX time (epoch), and used to correlate events and create timelines. It covers the critical role of the `_time` field in searching and analysis.
resources.source_subdomain: Time, Timestamps, and Log Correlation Basics

resources.title: Introduction to SIEM
resources.description: An interactive, hands-on room that introduces the core concepts of a SIEM. It covers log collection, normalization, and a dedicated section on the correlation of logs from different sources to identify malicious activity patterns, which heavily relies on accurate timestamps.
resources.source_subdomain: Time, Timestamps, and Log Correlation Basics

resources.title: UTC and Time Zones
resources.description: Clear and concise official documentation from the Security Onion project explaining the cybersecurity best practice of logging in UTC. It details why this is critical for correlating events across different systems and avoiding issues with daylight savings time.
resources.source_subdomain: Time, Timestamps, and Log Correlation Basics

resources.title: Considerations for timestamps in centralized logging platforms
resources.description: A detailed blog post from Elastic that explains the critical role timestamps play in correlating entries across multiple log streams. It covers concepts like time source, precision, time zones, and the importance of clock synchronization with NTP.
resources.source_subdomain: Time, Timestamps, and Log Correlation Basics

packs.subdomain: SIEM Core Components and Data Flow Architecture

resources.title: QRadar architecture overview
resources.description: Official IBM documentation detailing the three-layer architecture of QRadar. It explains the data collection, data processing, and data search layers, and how components like Event Collectors, Flow Collectors, and Processors work together to provide security intelligence.
resources.source_subdomain: SIEM Core Components and Data Flow Architecture

resources.title: Microsoft Sentinel architecture in the Microsoft Defender portal
resources.description: This official Microsoft Learn documentation provides a detailed overview of the Microsoft Sentinel architecture. It covers the core components like Log Analytics workspaces for data storage, data connectors for ingestion, and how it integrates with the broader Microsoft Defender ecosystem.
resources.source_subdomain: SIEM Core Components and Data Flow Architecture

resources.title: How I built a SIEM home lab for security monitoring and threat analysis
resources.description: A step-by-step tutorial on building a functional SIEM home lab using Wazuh. The guide covers setting up virtual machines, including a honeypot to generate logs, and configuring the SIEM to monitor and analyze the data, providing practical experience in SIEM data flow.
resources.source_subdomain: SIEM Core Components and Data Flow Architecture

resources.title: Splunk Architecture Components
resources.description: Official Splunk documentation that describes the key components of a Splunk deployment. It explains the roles of forwarders (data collection), indexers (data processing and storage), and search heads (data search and visualization), which are fundamental to understanding its data flow architecture.
resources.source_subdomain: SIEM Core Components and Data Flow Architecture

resources.title: IBM QRadar Architecture Tutorial
resources.description: A concise video tutorial explaining the core architecture of IBM QRadar. It visually breaks down the data flow from collection through processing to the generation of offenses, making it a great introductory resource for understanding how QRadar components interact.
resources.source_subdomain: SIEM Core Components and Data Flow Architecture

packs.subdomain: Detection Content: Rules, Signatures, and Use Cases

resources.title: Create and manage scheduled analytics rules in Microsoft Sentinel
resources.description: Official Microsoft documentation on how to create custom analytics rules from scratch or by modifying existing templates. It covers the entire rule creation wizard, including setting rule logic with KQL, configuring incident creation settings, and setting up automated responses.
resources.source_subdomain: Detection Content: Rules, Signatures, and Use Cases

resources.title: Boss of the SOC (BOTS)
resources.description: Boss of the SOC (BOTS) is a jeopardy-style, capture-the-flag-esque (CTF) activity where participants use Splunk's Security Suite to answer questions about real-world security incidents. It provides a realistic dataset and environment to practice threat hunting, investigation, and applying detection logic.
resources.source_subdomain: Detection Content: Rules, Signatures, and Use Cases

resources.title: Create a detection rule
resources.description: Official Elastic documentation detailing the process of creating various types of detection rules within the Elastic Security SIEM. It covers custom query rules, machine learning rules, threshold rules, and event correlation rules, providing the foundational knowledge for building detection content on the Elastic Stack.
resources.source_subdomain: Detection Content: Rules, Signatures, and Use Cases

resources.title: How to engineer a detection rule for your SIEM
resources.description: A written tutorial that walks through the lifecycle of a detection rule, from identifying the need and gathering requirements to configuration, testing, validation, and tuning. It provides a solid conceptual framework for developing effective detection use cases.
resources.source_subdomain: Detection Content: Rules, Signatures, and Use Cases

resources.title: SEC555: SIEM with Tactical Analytics
resources.description: An in-depth, lab-heavy SANS course focused on achieving actionable intelligence from a SIEM. It covers SIEM architecture, log analysis, and developing tactical detection and response capabilities. The course culminates in a full-day, hands-on capstone exercise applying the principles learned.
resources.source_subdomain: Detection Content: Rules, Signatures, and Use Cases

packs.subdomain: Alert Triage and Noise Reduction Concepts in SIEM

resources.title: Tuning false positives in IBM QRadar
resources.description: Official IBM documentation detailing the procedure for tuning false positive events and flows within QRadar to prevent them from creating offenses. It covers the necessary permissions and steps to create custom rules for noise reduction.
resources.source_subdomain: Alert Triage and Noise Reduction Concepts in SIEM

resources.title: Alert Triage With Splunk
resources.description: A hands-on lab where you act as a SOC analyst to investigate alerts using Splunk. The room covers triaging alerts from different environments (Linux, Windows, web server) to identify and analyze potential security incidents like brute-force attacks, persistence, and web shells.
resources.source_subdomain: Alert Triage and Noise Reduction Concepts in SIEM

resources.title: Stop Sentinel Alert Noise: A Practical Rule Tuning Guide
resources.description: A detailed, practical guide on how to reduce alert fatigue in Microsoft Sentinel. It provides step-by-step instructions on identifying noisy rules, using automation to handle benign positives, and refining KQL queries to make detections more precise.
resources.source_subdomain: Alert Triage and Noise Reduction Concepts in SIEM

resources.title: Get fine-tuning recommendations for your analytics rules in Microsoft Sentinel
resources.description: Official Microsoft documentation explaining how to use Sentinel's machine learning-powered tuning recommendations to reduce false positives. It shows how to view and apply insights to refine analytics rules for better accuracy.
resources.source_subdomain: Alert Triage and Noise Reduction Concepts in SIEM

resources.title: Suppress risk notables to reduce alert noise
resources.description: A tutorial from Splunk's official documentation that walks through the process of suppressing benign risk notables in Splunk Enterprise Security. This is a key technique for reducing alert noise when using a Risk-Based Alerting (RBA) methodology.
resources.source_subdomain: Alert Triage and Noise Reduction Concepts in SIEM

packs.subdomain: Core Concepts and Terminology of Threat Modeling

resources.title: Threat Modeling Security Fundamentals
resources.description: An official Microsoft learning path that covers the four main phases of threat modeling, how to use data-flow diagrams, and applying the STRIDE framework. It is designed to teach the fundamentals of identifying and mitigating security risks early in the development lifecycle.
resources.source_subdomain: Core Concepts and Terminology of Threat Modeling

resources.title: Threat Modeling Cheat Sheet
resources.description: A concise and actionable reference from the Open Web Application Security Project (OWASP). It breaks down threat modeling into four basic steps: application decomposition, threat identification, ranking, and mitigations. This is a key piece of official documentation for the security community.
resources.source_subdomain: Core Concepts and Terminology of Threat Modeling

resources.title: Threat modeling: Technical walkthrough and tutorial
resources.description: A practical, step-by-step guide that walks through the process of creating a threat model. It covers designing the model, applying zones of trust, discovering threats with STRIDE, and exploring mitigations, providing a hands-on learning experience.
resources.source_subdomain: Core Concepts and Terminology of Threat Modeling

resources.title: Threat Modeling: The Essentials Toolkit (SKF201)
resources.description: A comprehensive course designed for developers and IT professionals to learn how to identify, assess, and address threats in system design. It covers various frameworks like STRIDE, DREAD, and PASTA, and includes hands-on labs for practical application.
resources.source_subdomain: Core Concepts and Terminology of Threat Modeling

packs.subdomain: STRIDE and Other Threat Classification Schemes

resources.title: Threat Modeling Tool
resources.description: Official documentation for Microsoft's Threat Modeling Tool. It is a core element of the Microsoft Security Development Lifecycle (SDL) and uses the STRIDE methodology to find security issues in the design phase of software projects.
resources.source_subdomain: STRIDE and Other Threat Classification Schemes

resources.title: STRIDE Threat Modeling Tutorial
resources.description: An interactive, hands-on lab where you apply the STRIDE methodology to identify threats in a sample e-commerce web application architecture by examining its data flow diagram.
resources.source_subdomain: STRIDE and Other Threat Classification Schemes

resources.title: Threat Modeling Cheat Sheet
resources.description: A concise and actionable reference from the OWASP Cheat Sheet Series. It breaks down the threat modeling process into four steps and discusses various approaches, including STRIDE, PASTA, and others.
resources.source_subdomain: STRIDE and Other Threat Classification Schemes

resources.title: LINDDUN PRO Instructions
resources.description: Official methodology and instructions for LINDDUN PRO, a systematic approach to privacy threat modeling. It provides guidance, threat trees, and mapping tables to identify privacy-specific threats in a system design.
resources.source_subdomain: STRIDE and Other Threat Classification Schemes

resources.title: PASTA Threat Modeling
resources.description: A detailed article explaining the Process for Attack Simulation and Threat Analysis (PASTA), a seven-stage, risk-centric threat modeling methodology developed by VerSprite. It outlines each stage, from defining objectives to risk and impact analysis.
resources.source_subdomain: STRIDE and Other Threat Classification Schemes

packs.subdomain: Defining Assets, Trust Boundaries, and Attack Surfaces

resources.title: Threat Modeling Security Fundamentals
resources.description: This official learning path from Microsoft covers the core phases of threat modeling. It includes modules on creating data-flow diagrams, identifying elements like processes and trust boundaries, and using frameworks to identify threats.
resources.source_subdomain: Defining Assets, Trust Boundaries, and Attack Surfaces

resources.title: Threat Modeling Process
resources.description: The official OWASP guide to the threat modeling process. It provides a structured approach, detailing how to scope the work by identifying assets, entry points, and trust levels, which are foundational to defining attack surfaces.
resources.source_subdomain: Defining Assets, Trust Boundaries, and Attack Surfaces

resources.title: Create a threat model using data-flow diagram elements
resources.description: A step-by-step, interactive module on creating data-flow diagrams (DFDs). It specifically covers how to represent and use key elements like processes, data stores, and trust boundaries to build an effective threat model.
resources.source_subdomain: Defining Assets, Trust Boundaries, and Attack Surfaces

resources.title: How to approach threat modeling
resources.description: A blog post from AWS that outlines the core steps of threat modeling in a cloud context. It explains how to identify assets, actors, entry points, and trust levels as part of building a design diagram for analysis.
resources.source_subdomain: Defining Assets, Trust Boundaries, and Attack Surfaces

resources.title: Attack Surface Analysis Cheat Sheet
resources.description: A concise reference guide from OWASP focused specifically on defining and analyzing an application's attack surface. It details how to identify entry and exit points, assets, and user roles to map out potential attack vectors.
resources.source_subdomain: Defining Assets, Trust Boundaries, and Attack Surfaces

packs.subdomain: Attack Trees and Abuse Case Modeling

resources.title: Threat Modeling Process
resources.description: Official documentation from OWASP outlining a structured approach to threat modeling. It covers the entire process, including the use of threat trees for analysis and the consideration of use and abuse cases to identify weaknesses.
resources.source_subdomain: Attack Trees and Abuse Case Modeling

resources.title: Abuse Case Cheat Sheet
resources.description: A detailed guide from the OWASP Cheat Sheet Series focused on abuse cases. It explains what they are, why they are important, and provides a step-by-step process for defining them, including how to derive them from threat modeling activities like the OWASP Top 10.
resources.source_subdomain: Attack Trees and Abuse Case Modeling

resources.title: Practical threat modelling exercises for researchers
resources.description: A lightweight, practical guide that introduces three simple threat modeling approaches: STRIDE, DREAD, and attack trees. It provides clear, step-by-step instructions on how to use attack trees to visualize how an attack could unfold, making it a great hands-on starting point.
resources.source_subdomain: Attack Trees and Abuse Case Modeling

resources.title: Attack Tree Analysis for Threat Modeling
resources.description: A video tutorial that explains how to use attack trees as a goal-centric threat modeling approach. It covers the structure of attack trees, how to iterate over leaf nodes to find threats, and references existing resources like the 15 threat trees from the Microsoft Press book on the topic.
resources.source_subdomain: Attack Trees and Abuse Case Modeling

resources.title: A Step by Step Guide to Attack Tree-based Risk Analysis
resources.description: This guide provides a detailed, four-phase process for conducting risk analysis using attack trees. It covers creating the vulnerability model, defining adversary profiles, analyzing the model to predict attacker behavior, and introducing countermeasures.
resources.source_subdomain: Attack Trees and Abuse Case Modeling

packs.subdomain: Threat Likelihood and Impact Assessment Methods

resources.title: Threat Modeling Process
resources.description: Official documentation from the Open Web Application Security Project (OWASP) detailing a structured approach to threat modeling. It covers threat identification using methodologies like STRIDE and discusses ranking threats, which involves assessing likelihood and impact as part of the risk mitigation strategy.
resources.source_subdomain: Threat Likelihood and Impact Assessment Methods

resources.title: DREAD Threat Modeling: An Introduction to Qualitative Risk Analysis
resources.description: A detailed written tutorial explaining the DREAD model for quantitatively assessing cyber threats. It breaks down each category (Damage, Reproducibility, Exploitability, Affected Users, Discoverability) with scoring examples, providing a practical method for rating and prioritizing threats based on their calculated risk level.
resources.source_subdomain: Threat Likelihood and Impact Assessment Methods

resources.title: Microsoft Threat Modeling Tool
resources.description: This resource provides access to and documentation for the Microsoft Threat Modeling Tool, a core element of the Microsoft Security Development Lifecycle (SDL). The tool facilitates the identification and mitigation of potential security issues by using the STRIDE methodology to automatically generate potential threats and guide users through the analysis and mitigation process.
resources.source_subdomain: Threat Likelihood and Impact Assessment Methods

resources.title: A basic risk assessment and management method
resources.description: A step-by-step guide from the UK's NCSC on conducting a basic cyber security risk assessment. Step 6 specifically details how to estimate likelihood by combining threat and vulnerability analysis, and Step 3 covers assessing impact, providing a foundational government-backed methodology.
resources.source_subdomain: Threat Likelihood and Impact Assessment Methods

resources.title: Modelling Threats - Strategies in Threat Modelling
resources.description: A comprehensive course that covers key threat modeling methodologies like STRIDE and DREAD. It includes hands-on activities with tools like OWASP Threat Dragon and Microsoft Threat Model, equipping learners with practical skills to analyze, assess, and mitigate security risks.
resources.source_subdomain: Threat Likelihood and Impact Assessment Methods

packs.subdomain: Lab Environment Isolation and Reset Mechanisms

resources.title: Guidance for Workload Isolation on AWS
resources.description: Official AWS guidance describing how to use AWS accounts and Organizations as a fundamental mechanism for achieving workload isolation. This is key for creating secure boundaries for lab environments to reduce blast radius.
resources.source_subdomain: Lab Environment Isolation and Reset Mechanisms

resources.title: Docker Engine security
resources.description: Official Docker documentation explaining the security aspects of the Docker Engine. It details how kernel namespaces and control groups (cgroups) provide the isolation necessary for running containers, a common technology for lab environments.
resources.source_subdomain: Lab Environment Isolation and Reset Mechanisms

resources.title: Building More Secure Lab Environments with the AWS Cloud Development Kit
resources.description: A practical, hands-on session from an AWS event demonstrating how to use the AWS CDK to automate the creation of secure lab environments. It covers common mistakes and how to implement solutions for dynamic password management and locked-down security groups, which are crucial for repeatable and secure labs.
resources.source_subdomain: Lab Environment Isolation and Reset Mechanisms

resources.title: How to Reset/Delete A Vagrant Development Environment
resources.description: A straightforward tutorial explaining how to use the 'vagrant destroy' command to completely remove and reset a virtual machine-based lab environment. This is a fundamental mechanism for ensuring a clean state for repeatable experiments in an attack lab.
resources.source_subdomain: Lab Environment Isolation and Reset Mechanisms

resources.title: About GDC Sandbox
resources.description: Official Google Cloud documentation on GDC Sandbox, a managed and isolated environment for development and testing. It explains that sandbox instances are non-persistent and are refreshed monthly, returning them to a default state, which is a key reset mechanism.
resources.source_subdomain: Lab Environment Isolation and Reset Mechanisms

packs.subdomain: Designing Vulnerable-by-Design Lab Scenarios

resources.title: OWASP Vulnerable Web Applications Directory (VWAD)
resources.description: An official OWASP project that provides a comprehensive and curated registry of known vulnerable web and mobile applications. These can be used as the foundation for lab scenarios, saving designers the effort of building an application from scratch. The directory categorizes apps as Online, Offline, Mobile, and VMs/ISOs.
resources.source_subdomain: Designing Vulnerable-by-Design Lab Scenarios

resources.title: How To Create Your Own Vulnerable CTF Machines
resources.description: A detailed, step-by-step written guide on the entire process of creating a vulnerable machine for CTF (Capture The Flag) scenarios. It covers planning the attack path, designing the theme, building the environment with VirtualBox and Vagrant, and configuring specific vulnerabilities like FTP misconfigurations and SUID exploits.
resources.source_subdomain: Designing Vulnerable-by-Design Lab Scenarios

resources.title: OWASP Security Shepherd
resources.description: A comprehensive web and mobile application security training platform. While it's a pre-built environment, it serves as an excellent reference for designing lab scenarios. It includes over sixty levels covering the OWASP Top Ten and provides a model for creating challenges with a gentle learning curve and clear explanations.
resources.source_subdomain: Designing Vulnerable-by-Design Lab Scenarios

resources.title: How to Build a Vulnerable Pentest Lab
resources.description: A practical video tutorial that walks through setting up a vulnerable Active Directory environment. The guide covers spinning up a domain controller and intentionally introducing common misconfigurations and vulnerabilities found in real-world penetration tests, offering a great perspective on infrastructure-focused lab design.
resources.source_subdomain: Designing Vulnerable-by-Design Lab Scenarios

resources.title: Building a Cybersecurity Home Lab Environment
resources.description: A course focused on the foundational steps of creating a personal cybersecurity lab. It covers setting up virtualization hosts (Hyper-V, VMware, VirtualBox), configuring isolated networks, and deploying both attack workstations (like Kali Linux) and intentionally vulnerable target systems.
resources.source_subdomain: Designing Vulnerable-by-Design Lab Scenarios

packs.subdomain: Flag Design and Scoring Models in Attack Labs

resources.title: Dynamic Value Challenges - CTFd Docs
resources.description: Official documentation from the CTFd platform explaining how dynamic value challenges work. The point value for these challenges decreases as more teams solve them. This resource details the parabolic decay function used, the required parameters (initial, decay, minimum), and includes a simulator to test different scoring variables.
resources.source_subdomain: Flag Design and Scoring Models in Attack Labs

resources.title: Attack-Defense CTFs - Scoring Formula
resources.description: A detailed reference on the components of scoring in Attack-Defense style CTFs. It explains how Attack, Defense, and Service-Level Agreement (SLA) points are calculated each round. The resource also discusses design tenets for a good scoring formula and provides real-world examples from various CTF competitions like FaustCTF and SaarCTF.
resources.source_subdomain: Flag Design and Scoring Models in Attack Labs

resources.title: How You Can Write CTF Challenges
resources.description: A blog post from the picoCTF team that guides creators on how to design good CTF challenges. It covers the importance of novelty, learning value, and solvability.
